which are you? democrat or republican? and, if you dont mind saying, why

I vote for the democratic party, allthough the green party closely matches were I stand on most issues. In the USA there are really only 2 choices. I pick the one that comes closest to my beliefs. I will NEVER vote for another republican after 1994 midterm election. In fact I would rather vote for adolf hitler or satan rather then a republican that is how bad the party has become.

I vote for the democratic party, allthough the green party closely matches were I stand on most issues. In the USA there are really only 2 choices. I pick the one that comes closest to my beliefs. I will NEVER vote for another republican after 1994 midterm election. In fact I would rather vote for adolf hitler or satan rather then a republican that is how bad the party has become.

 
 I'm a traditional republican who doesn't support current administration, but we're a disappearing species. I think the best political opportunity for the US public is an independent party that accept our economic demise and puts the country first in terms of civil liberties and fiscal responsibility. That'll be a long, uphill effort, but hopefully America's youth will become disillusioned with my generation raiding public funds for personal gain to the point of relearning what voting actually means. Other than morality issues I can't ascertain any difference between contemporary democrats or republicans.
yeah, you could have atleast put an "other" opition on there

I'm a conservative, but not a very staunch one. I'm a registered Republican simply because I'd like to vote in the primaries and it'll be a cold day in hell before I'm a registered Democrat. I could vote for a Democrat, but I'm not gonna belong to the party.
 
 Really though, I can't stand the overwhelming majority of politicians, regardless of party.

I think the best political opportunity for the US public is an independent party that accept our economic demise and puts the country first in terms of civil liberties and fiscal responsibility. That'll be a long, uphill effort, but hopefully America's youth will become disillusioned with my generation raiding public funds for personal gain to the point of relearning what voting actually means.
 

 
 
 I actually agree with you wouldn't it be nice if this happened.

I am neither, and therefore will not select either. Although the American politics are rather binary in outcome right now, there are about 1/3 of the populace that are 'independent'. That could mean they would never choose a party, or never join either part of the duopoly.
 
 I side w/limited government (fiscally and socially), with a strict adherence to the Constitution.
Very limited poll. Given a choice between the two, I would vote democrat, but otherwise there are a host of other political parties I'd vote for over them given a chance.
